title: What is a good head-mounted-display for 2D? - Quora

response.answer_text: Stereoscopic display is a natural result of using a display for each eye, so it’s hard to find a non-stereoscopic display. A VR headset is not overkill for this use-case, since they’re less expensive than a decent non-VR HMD. It’s just not well-suited for it, because VR headsets have more-visible subpixels that make them sub-par for watching video. Sony’s HMD is excellent for what you want to do, but it’s $700 - $1000, so you’d be much better off with a Gear VR and a Samsung phone. Gear VR is better for watching video than the better VR headsets, because of smaller sub-pixels on the phones that are used in the device.

There is no such thing as a HMD that doesn’t display for two eyes. Head mounted displays have to be mounted close to the head so that they aren’t hanging off your head like a lead weight. That doesn’t mean you have to have 3d. You can just as easily tell any HMD not to display separate images for each display and it will not be in 3d. I also would not recommend this for doing regular work. HMDs introduce some pretty bad habits for eye strain and I wouldn’t recommend using one for doing any kind of regular work.
